Troubleshooting Matrix
If the Resident describes an emergency with...
Then
Automatic Garage Doors
Instruct the Resident: “There are two sensors on opposite sides of the interior of the Garage door. Are those sensors aligned?”
If Yes: Go to the next step.
If No:
Instruct the Resident:
“Adjust the sensors on each side until they directly align with each other.”
If the issue is resolved, go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If the garage door is stuck open, go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If the garage door is stuck closed, instruct the
Resident:
“Please ensure the garage door is all the way in the down position.”
“Next you will need to find the red cord. Pull the red cord down to release the door from the opener.”
“Now pull the cord towards the interior of your garage."
“You should now be able to lift the door manually if you need to get your car out.”
“When needed, close the garage door manually”
Go to Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch.
Elevators/ Escalators
Ask the Resident: “Is anyone trapped or injured?”
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please hang up and call 911 immediately, you may call us back after.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If no, ask the Resident: “What is the location of the broken unit?” Document the Resident’s answer in the Meld Notes.
Go to: Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Hot Water Tank Failure
Ask the Resident: “Is water leaking directly from the tank?”
If Yes, Instruct the resident: "Locate the water valve near the tank, and turn it to the 'off' position."
Ask the Resident: Is the leak manageable with towels?
If no, go to: Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch, refer to Leaks/ Water Intrusion for additional information.
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please use towels to prevent water from pooling or spreading.”
Ask the Resident: “Is the tank Gas or Electric?”
If it’s Gas:
“Has your gas service been cut off?”
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please contact your gas service provider to make arrangements for your service to be reactivated.” Go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If no, ask the Resident: “Do you smell gas?”
If yes, “Please go outside immediately and contact your Gas company, you may call us back after you notify them of the leak.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch
If no, ask the Resident: “Is the pilot light out?”
If the pilot light is out, “Have you tried to re-light the pilot light?” Note the Resident’s answer in the Meld.

Instruct the Resident: “On the front of your hot water tank there is a Gas Valve, turn it to the “OFF” position. Next, locate the flex hose that runs across the front of your hot water tank to connect the gas to the lines. It’s usually yellow. At the other end of that hose, find the valve to shut off the gas at the line. Turn that valve to the OFF/ Closed position.” Review the After Hours Vendor Spreadsheet to verify if the local gas company offers a free pilot re-lighting service.
If it’s Electric:
“Has your electric service been cut off?”
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please contact your electric service provider to make arrangements for your service to be reactivated.” Go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If no, instruct the Resident: “Please locate the appropriate breaker, and tell me if it is in the on or off position?”
If the breaker is in the off position, instruct the Resident: “Please flip the breaker to the on position.”
If the breaker is in the on position, instruct the Resident: “Please turn it to the off position, pause for 5 seconds, and then return it to the on position.”
If the hot water tank still doesn’t work, instruct the Resident: “Please turn the breaker to the off position, and leave it in the off position until a Vendor arrives.”
If the request is received between 7:00 PM and 3:00 AM inform the Vendor they can make the service call the following morning.
Go to: Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Leaks/Water Intrustion

Ask the Resident: "Where is the leak/water coming from?" If the leak is small or weather-related, instruct thr Resident: "Immediate action will require you to please locate a large bucket, large bowl, or another household item that can help retain water until a maintenance technician can be dispatched directly to your home. Please make sure that you are frequently disposing of the collected water in order to avoid additional property damage." Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If the leak is bigger or unable to be contained use the following guide to instruct the Resident to locate the appropriate weather shut-off valve. If the leak is coming from a/ the:
Toilet - shut off is behind the unit.
Sinks - shut off is below the sink.
Shower/ tub - shut off the main water line.
Refrigerator - shut off the main water line.
Burst pipe - shut off the main water line.
Hot water tank - shut off is near the tank.
Clothes Washer - shut off is behind the appliance.
Dishwasher - shut off is under the kitchen sink.
Irrigation Sprinkler system - Shut off the main water line.
Fire safety sprinkler system - call the local fire department.
If the water leak is outside the home, the shut-off valve may also be outside the home.
Contact the Property Manager to locate water shut-off valves outside of homes.
If the Resident is unable to locate the water shut-off valve, Contact the Property Manager.
If the only toilet in the home, the hot water tank needs service, or the leak is unable to be contained, a vendor will need to be dispatched as soon as possible. Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Note: Multiple vendors may need to be dispatched, for example one for water remediation and one to repair the leaking appliance or equipment.

If the water leak is contained, or the water line is shut off, a vendor may be dispatched the following business day ONLY if the Resident has running and hot water and a usable bathroom. Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch.
If water is coming from an attached unit, instruct the caller to reach out to the Resident in the unit that is leaking to have them shut their water valve off.
No A/C
“Locate an air vent and tell me if you can feel  cool air coming from it?”

If there is cool air coming from the vent, instruct the Resident: “We suggest making adjustments to the vents in and around your home if you haven’t already. Please update your Maintenance Meld with the outcome of these adjustments.”
If there is warm air coming from the vent, ask the Resident: “Does your residence have more than one HVAC System?”
If yes, is one of them actively working?
If yes, instruct the Resident; “All occupants can find comfort in the areas where the Air Conditioning is currently working.” No New Maintenance Meld.
If there is one HVAC System in the residence; instruct the Resident:
“Please locate the breaker for your HVAC system. Is the breaker in the On or Off position?”
If it is in the off position, instruct the Resident:
“Please flip the breaker to the on position.”
If it is in the on position, instruct the Resident:
“Please turn the breaker to the off position, pause for 5 seconds, and then return it to the on position.”
Ask the Resident: “Is the HVAC System working?”
If yes, Close Maintenance Meld.
If no, ask the Resident: “Do you have any GFI outlets with a “reset’ button?”
If Yes, “Firmly press the reset button on the GFI outlet, starting with the ones closest to the HVAC System. Is the HVAC System working?”
If no, ask the Resident: “Have you checked your thermostat, and does it use batteries? If so, have they been replaced recently?”

If the thermostat display is off and it uses batteries instruct the Resident: “Please replace the batteries in your thermostat and update your Meld to notify us if this resolves the disruption.” Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If the HVAC Unit still isn’t cooling, ask the Resident: “Has your thermostat recently been adjusted to over 75 degrees?” Document the Resident’s answer.

If the Resident replies yes, educate them; “HVAC Professionals have found setting your thermostat above 75 degrees or more in temperatures at or above 75 degrees outside will cause your system to overwork to cool down when you get home. It may take up to 5 hours for your HVAC System to cool your home.”
If no, ask the Resident: “Have you checked your HVAC filter, and do you know the last time it was changed?”
If the filter has not recently been replaced, instruct the Resident; “Please locate your new HVAC Filter delivered by Second Nature and replace it on the unit.” Close Maintenance Meld.
Where allowable by local law, if the resident local temperatures do not exceed the interior temperature of the home, Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch.
If the Resident does not receive scheduled HVAC filter deliveries from Second Nature, or the HVAC System still isn’t cooling, Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
No Heat
Ask the Resident: “Is your heat Gas or Electric?”
Go to Electric Heating troubleshooting.

If it’s Gas: ask the Resident: “Has your gas service been cut off?” If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please contact your gas service provider to make arrangements for your service to be reactivated.” Go to No New Maintenance Meld.

If no, ask the Resident: “Do you smell gas?”If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please go outside immediately and contact your Gas company, you may call us back after you notify them of the leak.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If no, ask the Resident: “Is the pilot light out?”
If the pilot light is out, ask the Resident: “Have you tried to re-light the pilot light?” Note the Resident’s answer in the Meld.
Instruct the Resident; “On or near your furnace there is a light switch that controls the gas flow to your furnace. Find that switch and turn it to the off position.”
If the pilot light is not out, ask the Resident:
“Have you checked your furnace filter, and do you know the last time it was changed?”
If the filter has not been recently replaced, instruct the Resident: “Please locate their new Furnace Filter delivered by Second Nature and replace it on the furnace.” Go to Closed Maintenance Meld.
If the Resident does not receive scheduled furnace filter deliveries from Second Nature, document the Resident response in the Meld and go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If the filter has recently been replaced, ask the Resident: “Have you checked your thermostat, does it use batteries? If so, have they been replaced recently?”

If the thermostat display is off and it uses batteries instruct the Resident: “Please replace the batteries in your thermostat and update your Meld to notify us if this resolves the disruption.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If it’s Electric:

“Has your electric service been cut off?”If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please contact your electric service provider to make arrangements for your service to be reactivated.” Go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If no, instruct the Resident: “Please locate the appropriate breaker, and tell me if it is in the on or off position?”
If the breaker is in the off position, instruct the Resident: “Please flip the breaker to the on position.”

If the breaker is in the on position, instruct the Resident: “Please turn it to the off position, pause for 5 seconds, and then return it to the on position.” If the furnace still doesn’t work, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.

If the heating system consists of Radiators, ask the Resident: “Is there water leaking from the radiator?”If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please turn the water valve on the radiator to the Off or Closed position until a Service Technician arrives.”
Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If no, ask the Resident: “Is the radiator making knocking or banging noises, but still producing heat?”
If the radiator is producing heat but making knocking or banging noises, go to Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch.
No Running Water

Ask the Resident: “Is there no running water in the whole home, or just in one area?If there is no running water in just one area (one room or at one item), instruct the Resident: “Please locate the shut-off valve near that room or item and turn it to the on position if it is not already.”
Use the following guide to instruct the Resident to locate the appropriate water shut-off valve.
If the leak is coming from a/the:
Toilet - shut off is behind the unit.
Sinks - shut off is below the sink.
Shower/ tub - shut off the main water line.
Refrigerator - shut off the main water line.
Burst pipe - shut off the main water line.
Hot water tank - shut off is near the tank.
Clothes Washer - shut off is behind the appliance.
Dishwasher - shut off is under the kitchen sink.
If the whole home has no running water:
“Have you checked to see if there is an outage in your area?”

If no, instruct the Resident: “Please check with your water service provider regarding any local outages or water main breaks. You may update your Meld with the information you find.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If there are no reports of local outages, ask the Resident: “Has your most recent water bill been paid?”
If the water bill has not been paid, instruct the Resident: “Please contact your water service provider to make arrangements for your service to be reactivated.” Go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If the water bill has been paid, ask the Resident: “Have there been any service requests regarding your plumbing in the last 24 hours?”
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please locate the main water shut-off valve, and tell me if it is in the on or off position?”
If the Main water valve is in the off position, instruct the Resident: “Please turn the valve to the on position”

If the water now runs, document the Meld and assign it to the appropriate Maintenance Coordinator to be addressed the next business day. Please note to the Maintenance Coordinator that the previous vendor left the Resident’s main water valve off after their service call. Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If the Main water valve is in the on position, and there is (still) no running water, instruct the Resident: “It seems there must be either a local outage or a water service interruption.

Please update the Meld with any information you find regarding a local outage or water service interruption. If the issue remains unresolved in 24 hours please update the Meld so we can dispatch a Vendor to your home.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
Ask the Resident: “Have you noticed any water outside of the home, any pooling or large puddles?”
If yes, dispatch a plumber immediately, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If the Resident’s pipes/ water lines have frozen, ask the Resident: “Is the whole house impacted, or just one area?”
Instruct the Resident: “Please locate the frozen pipe.” Document the location in the Meld if able.

Educate the Resident: “To Prevent Frozen Pipes in the future, any time temperatures drop below freezing, leave your faucets dripping at night and/ or if you will be away from the home for any period of time.”

Inform the Resident: “We will dispatch a plumber as soon as they are available. If your water begins running again, please call us back immediately at 855-420-PURE.” Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Non-working Appliance
Go to No New Maintenance Meld.
Non-Working Refrigerator
If the Resident expresses a medication or formula that requires refrigeration, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Instruct the Resident: “Please locate the appropriate breaker, and tell me if it is in the on or off position?”
If the breaker is in the off position, instruct the Resident:
“Please flip the breaker to the on position.”
If the breaker is in the on position, instruct the Resident: “Please turn it to the off position, pause for 5 seconds, and then return it to the on position.”
If the refrigerator still is not on, ask the Resident: “Is the refrigerator plugged into a GFI outlet with a “reset’ button?”
If Yes, “Unplug the refrigerator. Firmly press the reset button. Plug the refrigerator back in to see if it’s working.”
If no, or if resetting the GFI outlet is unsuccessful, go to Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch.
Pest Control/Animal Intrusion
Ask the Resident: “Is anyone injured or in danger of being injured?”
If yes, “Please go outside immediately and call 911. You may log in to Property Meld to update your Service Request.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If no, go to No New Maintenance Meld.
Resident Lock-outs Inform the Resident:
Inform the Resident: “Resident Lock-Outs are handled on a case-by-case basis during normal business hours and after hours.”
Locate the Branch in the PURE After-Hours Vendor Database by Branch for any branch-specific guidance.
Safety Concern, i.e. broken window, door, lock
Ask the Resident: “Is the damage related to criminal activity?”
If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please hang up and dial 911, you may call us back after” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If no, ask the Resident: “Is the damage weather related?”
If the damage is weather related and is...
A Broken Window/ Door; Instruct the Resident: “Please try to secure the window/door as best you can while we locate a Vendor.”.
If the Resident still has safety concerns, instruct the Resident: “You may want to leave the Residence and seek safety in a locked car or at a neighbor or relative's home.”
Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Dispatch a vendor immediately to secure the residence.
A Broken Exterior Lock on a main exterior entrance, i.e. front or back door: Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Dispatch a locksmith immediately to secure the residence.
A Broken Interior lock (i.e. Garage door to home)
Ask the Resident: is anyone trapped or injured?”
If someone is injured, instruct the Resident:“Please hang up and call 911 immediately, you may call us back after.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If no one is trapped, go to No New Maintenance Meld.
If no one is injured, but someone is trapped in a room or bathroom, ask the Resident: “What do you see on the locked doorknob on the outside, is there a hole or something that looks like a screw?”

If there is a hole, instruct the Resident: “Above the door frame of the door there may be a door pin, it looks like a straightened paperclip with a loop at the end. Locate the door pin or a similar household item to stick in the hole. Do not use an item that could break off into the doorknob or the resulting repairs will be billable to you. Insert the door pin into the hole and carefully wiggle it around until you feel it catch the locking mechanism.”

If there is a screw on the doorknob instruct the Resident: “Please locate a flathead screwdriver or a similar household item like a butterknife to turn the screw and unlock the door from the outside.”
If the doorknob has a different locking mechanism instruct the Resident to search YouTube to find additional instructions.
If the door unlocks, go to Closed Maintenance Meld.
If the lock still will not unlock, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Septic/ Sewer/ Sump Pump Failure
Ask the Resident: is there septic or sewage backing into your toilet, bathtub, or sinks?
If Yes, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If no, continue to troubleshoot for Sump Pump, or Sewer/ Septic.
Sump Pump
Ask the Resident: “Is there noise coming from your sump pump?”
If no, ask the Resident: “Have you heard the sump pump turn on in the last one (1) to three (3) hours?” Note the answer.
Ask the Resident: “Has there been a recent power outage?”
If the resident says the power is currently out, inform the Resident: “Your sump pump should resume working when the power comes back on.”
Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If there is power in the home, instruct the Resident: “Please locate the power switch on the Sump Pump and turn it to the on position.”
If the sump pump still doesn’t turn on or the switch is already in the on position, instruct the Resident: “Please locate the appropriate breaker, and tell me if it is in the on or off position?”
If the breaker is in the off position, instruct the Resident: “Please flip the breaker to the on position.”
If the breaker is in the on position, instruct the Resident: “Please turn it to the off position, pause for 5 seconds, and then return it to the on position.”
Ask the Resident: “Do you hear any noises coming from the sump pump now?”
If yes, go to Closed Maintenance Meld.
If no, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
If the sump pump is operating but water is accumulating and not draining, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.

Sewer/ SepticDocument the Meld with any information the Resident can provide to determine if the request will require remediation in addition to a plumber then go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Weather-related damage (roof, windows, doors),
Ask the Resident: “Is there a storm currently in your area?”
If yes: “Follow Storm Protocol”
If no, ask the Resident: “Has your personal security been compromised by the damage to the home?”

If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please seek temporary shelter immediately.” Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch. The After-Hours Maintenance Team Member must immediately Place an outbound call to a PURE Team Member.
If the resident’s security has not been compromised but the branch does not re-open for more than 24 hours dispatch a vendor. Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Smoke Alarms
Never tell a Resident to disable a Smoke Alarm, do not permit a Resident to disable a smoke alarm. Smoke Alarms are required by law in all states.
Ask the Resident: “Does the smoke alarm use batteries?”
If yes, Instruct the Resident: “Please replace the batteries in your Smoke Alarm as soon as possible.”

If the smoke alarm is hard-wired, instruct the Resident: “Your smoke alarm has a backup battery system. Please replace the batteries as soon as possible. After you replace the batteries, find the breaker for the smoke alarm system and flip it on and then off to reset your smoke alarms.”
If the Resident can’t reach the smoke alarm or they don’t know how to access the battery, ask the Resident: “Are there any other smoke detectors in your house?”
If yes, go to Open Meld with Next Business-Day Dispatch
If no, go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.

If the battery replacement causes other smoke alarms in the home to activate, dispatch a vendor immediately. Inform the Resident “We will have someone out to your home as quickly as possible to service your smoke alarm system.” Go to Open Meld with Immediate Dispatch.
Mold
Instruct the Resident to No New Maintenance Meld.

If the Resident persists that they are not comfortable in the residence because there is a large amount of mold, place an outbound call to a PURE Team Member, and obtain direction from the On-call Property Manager.
Smells/ odors
Smells/ odors If the Resident is smelling sewer gas, rotten eggs, or other foul odors, Instruct the Resident to No New Maintenance Meld.
If the Resident is smelling natural gas, burning plastic, or smoke, instruct the Resident: “Please hang up and dial 911 immediately, you may call us back after.” Go to Open Meld with No Dispatch.
If the Resident persists that they are not comfortable in the residence because of the odor, place an outbound call to a PURE Team Member, and obtain direction from the On-call Property Manager.
Natural Disaster: Earthquake, Hurricane, Flooding, Tornado, or Blizzard

In the event a Resident calls in regarding a current natural disaster in their area, tell the Resident: “Thank you for calling the PURE Property Management After-hours Maintenance Service Team. Our priority at this time is your safety and well-being, are you in a safe location?”

If yes, instruct the Resident: “Please remain in a safe area until the natural disaster is over. You may log into Property Meld to create maintenance requests as needed. You will be contacted by a PURE Property Management Team Member if any other action is required. All Vendors and PURE Property Management Team Members in your area are experiencing the same Natural Disaster. Please be patient until it is safe for Vendors and PURE Property Management Team Members to move around your community.”

If no, instruct the Resident: “Please seek appropriate safety for the natural disaster you are experiencing. You may log into Property Meld to create maintenance requests as needed. You will be contacted by a PURE Property Management Team Member if any other action is required. All Vendors and PURE Property Management Team Members in your area are experiencing the same Natural Disaster. Please be patient until it is safe for Vendors and PURE Property Management Team Members to safely move around your community."
Go to No New Maintenance Meld.

Immediately email your Team Leader and the Director of Maintenance.

“We understand that you are having a maintenance emergency. One of our After-Hours Maintenance Service Team Members is working on a resolution. Suicide Threat/ Mental Health Crisis

Attempt to obtain as much identification and location information as possible. Document the information on the PURE PM Afterhours Maintenance Call Log. Immediately call 911 using the information obtained to request a well-check on the Resident.

If the caller is extremely distressed or there is a concern they may do something dangerous while on the call, reach out to your shift partner or Team Leader to immediately call the Property Manager on-call. Inform the Property Manager of the situation and instruct them to contact the Resident’s Emergency Contact.
Go to 988 - Lifeline Chat and Text to use the chat feature and contact crisis services for additional direction.

The Team Leader or your shift Partner should call 911 (if they haven’t been called already) while you keep the caller on the line. Email the Team Leader and Director of Maintenance with as much detail regarding the call and any actions taken (i.e. calling emergency response services). Document the “time of call” for any calls made to emergency response services.
Centralized Maintenance Department (CMD) Emergency Weather
Storm Damage Email
Storm Damage Meld Tag
Storm Affecting CMD Emergency Weather Response Team
Storm Affecting After-Hours Call Center
Storm Tracking and Surveillance

In the event of a potential natural disaster or extreme inclement weather within the continental United States, the Centralized Maintenance Department (CMD) Emergency Weather Response Team performs the duties detailed in this procedure.
A Natural disaster or extreme inclement weather can be defined as:
Earthquake
Tornado
Hurricane
Wildfire
Extreme cold/ winter event
The Emergency Weather Response team includes:
Regional Maintenance Team Leaders
Director of Maintenance
CMD Project Coordinator

They oversee the storm damage email and After Hours Emergency Maintenance Line during regular business hours during and after an emergency weather event. If an Emergency Weather Response Team Member cannot work safely or loses internet access due to the storm, they are not expected to perform these duties until they are safe.

When a storm occurs Residents are advised by the office's Operations Manager(s) to relay any storm-related damage to the storm.damage@purepm.co and include their appropriate maintenance platform when possible. If damage is reported to storm.damage@purepm.co an automated response asks Residents for important information such as PURE Office Name, property address, and Resident name and phone number. Once this information is collected, our on-call Emergency Weather Response team will determine the best course of action by inputting a Meld/Service Request or assigning a vendor. The Emergency Weather Response Team Member responds to the Resident advising of the next steps. This email includes the Maintenance Coordinator and Operations Manager if the Emergency Weather Response team determines this is necessary.The inbox at storm.damage@purepm.co is checked every hour by members of the Emergency Weather Response team for 7 days after the end of the storm event to monitor for any further reports of damage.

When storm damage is reported through PropertyMeld, a tag with the name of the storm event and year is made (i.e., Hurricane Carlos 2023/Ice Storm 2023). This tag provides tracking for specific emergency weather events and the related workload/damage.
An Emergency Weather Response Team Member residing in an area impacted by a storm is expected to take necessary precautions and only work if they are safe.
Additional assistance could be required from the After-Hours Maintenance Service Call Center or Maintenance Coordinators to supplement storm-affected team members.
Offices affected by the event will also have team members on standby who may need to assist.

The CMD Emergency Weather Response Team may assist with calls until the After-Hours Maintenance Service Team Members are safe to return to their regular duties if an emergency weather event affects our after-hours call center.

Emergency Weather Response Team Members use WeatherUnderground to track extreme weather conditions throughout the US to maintain a good knowledge of potential weather conditions that will cause maintenance issues. Alerts are shared among the Emergency Weather Response Team Members and leadership so the Emergency Weather Response team is actively aware of events that may require their attention.

An existing Resident may request to have their Residential Rental Agreement modified by adding a new Resident, or Animal.

The Property Manager is responsible for ensuring that all PURE policies and procedures are adhered to, that proper lease addendum(s) are implemented, and that any associated lease modification fees are paid.
No lease modification is complete until all PURE procedures have been satisfied, the appropriate addendum(s) implemented, and the lease modification fee has been paid.
Lease Modification Workflow
Step 1: The Request to Modify is Received
The Resident will contact the Property Manager in writing to request a Residential Rental  Agreement.
Step 2: The Request to Modify is Reviewed
The Property Manager will review the request to modify for lease compliance.
Step 3: The Request to Modify is Processed
The Property Manager will process the request to modify depending on the content of the modification request.
If
Then
The Resident is adding an Animal
The Property Manager will follow the adding an Animal Workflow.
The Resident is removing an Animal
The Property Manager will follow the Removing an Animal Workflow.
The Resident is adding a Resident
The Property Manager will instruct the Resident to have the potential occupant follow the Rental Application Process.
The Resident is removing another Resident
The remaining individual(s) must qualify on their own and all parties must sign and agree to the removal.
The Resident is requesting another lease modification
The Property Manager will verify the terms of the Addendum with the Client and draft the Addendum for inclusion in the modified lease.
Step 4: Drafting the Addendum
The PM drafts the appropriate addendum for the modification.
Step 5: Signing and Countersigning of the Addendum
The PM sends the addendum to the Resident for signature via the PMS; following the Resident's signing, the PM will review the signed addendum and counter-sign.
Step 6: Collection of the Lease Modification Fee(s)
The PM collects the appropriate lease modification fee and adds any applicable fees to the Resident’s ledger.

Any action, intentional or unintentional, that conflicts with the terms of the signed Residential Rental Agreement is considered a violation of lease compliance. If found to be non-compliant, all Residents are provided a reasonable opportunity to cure or rectify a lease violation under the PURE Lease Violation Corrective Action process. In the event a Resident has multiple lease violations, or a single violation exceeds a reasonable repair plan, PURE reserves the right to terminate a Residential Rental Agreement early.
Lease Violation Workflow
Step 1: The Lease Violation is Reported or Witnessed
The PM will be notified of non-compliance by:
Neighbor reports
Field Technician reports
Any eyes on the property or property evaluation
The PM tracks and documents all instances of non-compliance, corrective action(s) taken, and any charged fees.
Step 2: Reviewing the Lease Violation

The PM is responsible for reviewing the Resident’s PURE rental history in order to manage substantial lease violations, for example - drug use, crime, and domestic violence.All lease violation reviews and associated recommendations are required to be in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.
If
Then
The lease violation requires Resident action
AND
The property does not require complex repairs,
The Property Manager will contact the Resident and coordinate with the Field Technician to schedule a Property Evaluation.
The Property Manager will notify the Resident via the PMS of:
Described non-compliance
Instructions for corrective action
The date upon which non-compliance is expected to be corrected
Any associated fees
The lease violation requires a repair categorized as an Essential Service or High Priority,

1. Contact the Resident and coordinate with the Field Technician to schedule a Property Evaluation.2. Coordinate with the Maintenance team to create a new maintenance work order to request estimates.3. Notify the Resident via the PMS of:
Described non-compliance
Instructions for corrective action
The date upon which non-compliance is expected to be corrected Any associated fees
Step 3. Corrective Action Resolution
It is the Branch's responsibility to understand any applicable state or local requirements for lease violations or corrective action requests, including any required posted legal documents.
If
Then
The Resident or a PURE-approved Vendor completes the Corrective Action Request,
The Property Manager will:

1. Verify the repair or corrective action has been completed.2. Update the Resident status to “Compliant” in the Property Management System.3. Verify all applicable before and after photos are uploaded to the Property Management System.
The Resident chooses not to complete the Corrective Action Request,
The Property Manager will begin the eviction process in accordance with state and local laws.

Resident rent is due on the 1st of each month. Residents have a grace period until the 5th of the month, at which point the rent is considered to be late, where applicable by law. The Property Manager will receive a Resident Delinquency Report via the PMS to assist in tracking delinquencies. If an automated report needs to be configured for the PM, that PM may reach out to the PURE Way Team via Slack at #ask-pure-way.

If rent is not received by the 5th of the month, the Property Manager must post late notices on the next business day, to inform the Resident that their rent is past due and must be paid immediately. All notices must be posted in compliance with state and local laws.
Send Late Rent Letter and Notification of Late Fee

On the 6th of the month or on the next available business day, the Property Manager will issue the Resident a Late Rent Letter in the PMS to notify the Resident that a late fee has been automatically applied to their ledger in the amount of 5% of their total rent, and that payment of their late rent is due immediately.
If
Then
The Property Manager is able to make contact with the Resident regarding late rent
The Property Manager will note on the office’s Delinquent Resident Report that the Resident has made a promise to pay, including a deadline and method of payment.
The Property Manager is unable to make contact with the Resident regarding late rent by the 10th of the month or the earliest possible,
The Property Manager will begin the eviction process in accordance with state and local laws.

In the event that a method of payment is returned or not cleared, Residents are charged the maximum NSF Fee allowed by state law, as detailed in the signed Residential Rental Agreement, for each NSF event that impacts PURE. If multiple fees are collected as a single payment and incur one NSF event, this is considered as one single event and not separate NSFs. NSF events are counted per 12 months starting from the first NSF event.

Following the Resident’s first NSF event, an NSF fee shall be applied to the Resident’s account. The Resident must make their next payment with certified funds. No subsequent payments will be required to be in certified funds.

Following the Resident’s second event, an NSF fee shall be applied to the Resident’s account. The Resident must make their next payment with certified funds, and shall be required to make payments via certified funds for 90 days. The requirement for certified funds can be removed after 90 days upon the Resident’s request. If any other NSFs occur, a new 90-day period requirement of certified funds will begin from the last NSF occurrence.
If
Then
The Resident experiences their first NSF event,
An NSF fee shall be applied to the Resident’s account. The Resident must make their next payment with certified funds.
The Resident experiences an additional NSF event or events,
An NSF fee shall be applied to the Resident’s account. The Resident must make their next payment with certified funds and shall be required to make payments via certified funds for 90 days.
For all subsequent NSF events, a new 90-day period requirement of certified funds will begin from the date of the last NSF occurrence.

If rent is not paid by the 10th of the month, the PM Pod will file the eviction notice either on that day or the next business day. Eviction notices must be filed, posted, and/or process serviced in accordance with state and local laws.
Step 1: A Petition for Eviction is Requested
The Senior Property Manager prepares an email request to the office Attorney and Operations Manager requesting an Eviction for Non-Payment with the following attachments:
Copy of Resident Ledger
Copy of Sent Late Letter
Copy of Residential Rental Agreement
Cares Act Form from the Client (Where required by local law)

The PM will update the Resident Profile in the PMS to reflect eviction status. If the system does not automatically disable the Resident Portal, the PM will manually disable it; however, keep email notifications to the Resident activated.
Step 2: The Resident is Notified
Eviction notices must be filed, posted, and/or process serviced in accordance with local city and/or state laws.
The PM will notify the Resident via email that:
A request for eviction has been initiated
Delinquencies past the 15th of the month must be paid in person via certified funds
An additional late fee of $100 has been automatically applied to their account
A $150 legal fee has also been added to their account
○ Legal fees cover the base attorney fees in the event the eviction is canceled
If
Then
The Resident pays the delinquent amount and all accrued fees,

1. The Senior PM will send an email to the Attorney, copy (cc) the PM, and cancel the Petition for Eviction.2. PURE Accounting will notify the PM that funds have been posted to reconcile the delinquency.3. The PM will reactivate the Resident’s Resident Portal and update the Resident’s Resident Portal Status.
The Resident does not contact the PM to make payment arrangements,
The PM Pod will continue efforts to recover the delinquent amount while waiting for notification from the attorney that the Petition for Eviction was filed with the appropriate court.
Step 3: Processing an Order of Eviction
Local Courts Grant or Deny Petition for Eviction
If
Then
The local courts grant an Order of Eviction,

1. The Resident will be served by the courts within the local eviction process.2. The Property Manager will send the Resident’s remaining balance to collections 90 days after the Move-Out date. All collection activities are subject to federal, state, and local regulations.
The local courts deny the Petition for Eviction,
OR
The Resident reconciles the delinquent account including all applicable fees,
The Property Manager will re-activate the Resident’s Resident Portal and update the Resident’s Resident Portal Status.

1. When a Resident chooses to terminate their Residential Rental Agreement before the maturity date, inform the Resident that the property will not be turned over to be re-leased until all applicable keys, remotes, and keyfobs are surrendered to the Property Manager.

2. Turnover and listing processes are expedited to mitigate financial impact to the Resident where applicable. A terminating Resident may request to have the property listed prior to surrendering the keys. The property can only be listed if it is without major defects impacting rent readiness.
3. The Security Deposit Disposition includes any early termination fees or owed month's rent in accordance with the signed Residential Rental Agreement.

When a Resident has provided notice of their intent to vacate a PURE-managed property, the Move-Out Process is triggered. The Notice to Vacate must be in writing and may be submitted physically or electronically at least 30 days prior to the move-out date selected by the Resident unless otherwise defined by the signed Residential Rental Agreement.

As soon as a Notice to Vacate is received, the Senior PM will review the corresponding Client’s PMA. If the signed PMA requires updated terms and/or conditions, the Senior Property Manager will facilitate a renewed Property Management Agreement.

If the PMA does not need updated terms and/or conditions and the Resident is not terminating their Residential Rental Agreement early, the Senior Property Manager will notify the Client that their property is going to be listed for rent with an estimated date and a price that correlates to the current market value.

An early termination of the lease constitutes a breach of the Residential Rental Agreement. All terms and conditions stated in the Residential Rental Agreement are applicable in compliance with state and local law. This includes the accrual of all program fees, rent, late fees, utilities, landscaping, and any other costs associated with the property, until the original Residential Rental Agreement end date.

A breach of the Residential Rental Agreement due to negligence or other violation of the Residential Rental Agreement terms may result in PURE terminating the Residential Rental Agreement. Under these circumstances, PURE will provide the Resident with a Notice to Vacate in compliance with state and local laws.

It is the Resident’s responsibility to leave the property in the agreed-upon condition per the Move-Out Checklist and the Residential Rental Agreement. It is the Property Manager's responsibility to verify that the Resident has completed the Move-Out Checklist and Move-Out Evaluation, in addition to any additional requirements for Move-Out as stipulated in the Residential Rental Agreement or applicable addendum(s).
The PM will coordinate with the Resident to:
Determine an official Move-Out date
Allow for the return of keys, remotes, and keyfobs
Deliver the Move-Out Checklist
Deliver Move-Out Evaluation Instructions
Deliver Resident portal Move-Out instructions
Notice To Vacate
The Property Manager calls the Resident to confirm receipt of their Notice to Vacate and to provide information on the PURE Way Move-Out process.
If
Then
the Notice to Vacate does not constitute an Early Termination
The PM Pod will prepare the Security Deposit Disposition.
the Notice to Vacate constitutes an Early Termination
The PM Pod will review the Resident’s legal and financial responsibilities until the end of the Residential Rental Agreement term.
The PM will clearly communicate to the Resident that they:
Are responsible for continuing to pay the rent until a new Resident is secured and begins paying rent

May be responsible for additional costs associated with preparing the property for a new Resident, for example: leasing fees, re-keying fees, and costs associated with painting, utilities, cleaning, and/or landscaping.

Step 2: The Resident Conducts the Move-Out Evaluation No Earlier Than 14 Days Prior to Scheduled Move-Out

The Property Manager is responsible for facilitating the Move-Out Evaluation process. The Resident must complete and submit the Move-Out Evaluation as part of the Resident Move-Out Checklist. The completed Move-Out Evaluation is reviewed and approved by the Property Manager.

The Property Manager will facilitate a post-vacancy Move-Out Evaluation to determine that no additional damages were incurred during the former Resident’s Move-Out. At the completion of the Move-Out Evaluation, the PM must secure the property, review the property’s condition at the Move-Out Evaluation, and remove any garbage.

The Property Manager will complete the Move-Out Evaluation within two (2) days of the Resident vacating the property, create and dispatch necessary work orders that are not pre-scheduled, and follow the Security Deposit Disposition process.

The Senior Property Manager will communicate turnover progress with the Client and is responsible for facilitating any required client contribution.

After all turnover work orders have been closed in the Property Management System (PMS) and the Resident Ledger has been fully reconciled with no outstanding balances, the Property Manager will compile the Security Deposit Disposition. Security Deposits must be refunded as soon as possible, and within the time frame dictated by state and local law.

In the event that a property is found to have excessive damage or there is a delayed completion of work orders by Vendors, some states may allow for the distribution of an “estimated disposition,” or for an extension of the allocated time. The office is responsible for ensuring compliance.

Any remaining balance on the Resident’s ledger, including fees, past due rent, or other incurred charges are also charged against the security deposit.

Then

Any portion of turnover work is NOT related to wear and tear, for example: Resident-inflicted damage or negligence, whether intentional or unintentional
The Property Manager will charge that amount against the Resident’s security deposit
OR
the PM will request payment from the Resident to cover the cost of damages, if the Resident is enrolled in the SDRP.

Americans With Disabilities Act

The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) became law in 1990. The ADA is a civil rights law that prohibits discrimination against individuals with disabilities in all areas of public life, including jobs, schools, transportation, and all public and private places that are open to the general public. The purpose of the law is to make sure that people with disabilities have the same rights and opportunities as everyone else.
Animal
A service animal or emotional support animal that plays a vital role in the Resident’s life such as a seeing eye dog.
Appfolio
A Property Management System (PMS) utilized by PURE Branches.
Approved Applicant An Applicant that has successfully completed the Resident Application and screening process and is proceeding to the Move-In Workflow.
Assistance Animal

An assistance animal is an animal that works, provides assistance, or performs tasks for the benefit of a person with a disability, or that provides emotional support that alleviates one or more identified effects of a person’s disability. An assistance animal is not a pet.
Auto Charges
Lease Charges that are set up within the PMS to charge the tenant fees on a routine basis automatically. Most are on a monthly recurring schedule.
BDR - Business Development Representative

PURE Representative whose job focus is to be the initial point of contact for our owners, acquire leads for property management services, negotiate the Property Management Agreement, property benchmarking and closing.
Benchmarking a Property
To analyze the financial characteristics of a potential property to compare to similar properties in the same market.
Break Lease
Termination of a rental agreement BEFORE the maturity date.
Business/User Action
Action generated by the user in the PURE Property Management System or PURE Portals (Resident, Client, admin console)
Buyout Agreement
An agreement where the landlord pays the tenant money or other consideration to vacate the residential rental property prior to the end of the lease term.

Churn Good Churn:When a Client terminates the Property Management Agreement because they have sold the property and PURE has brokered the sale, this is “good” churn because there is additional benefit derived from the transaction.
When a Client has sold the property and the new Client if that property signs a new Property Management Agreement with PURE.
Neutral Churn:The Client decides to move back into their property The Client sells the home, but PURE does not broker the sale.
The Client sells the home, but PURE does not retain the new Client.
Bad Churn:The Client is not satisfied with PURE service.The Client has decided to self-manage the property.
The Client has hired a new Property Manager that offers some level of differentiation from PURE.
PURE initiates the termination of the relationship due to non-performance by the Client.
Client
#1 The person or legal entity/entities holding interest of record to the Property.
#2 A “Client” is defined as a property investor or owner with one or more properties who wishes to hire PURE to manage their assets.
Client Contribution Funds that are provided in advance to cover the cost of  repairs, or fees charged at their property.
Client Insurance Insurance coverage for the structure(property) in place to provide safety should a loss occur.
Client Reserve Account Client-provided funds to be held with the Broker and be ready for use if charges arise.
Close Out Period
The period between the management end date and the date of loss where accounting is performing final accounting functions.
Note: This period is expected to be roughly 30 days.
Code of Ethics A guide of principles designed to help professionals conduct business honestly and with integrity.
Continuation of Utilities
This action is to establish an automated transfer of interim billing between tenants and the owner of a property at the transition of M/In M/Out.
Corporation
A company or group of people authorized to act as a single entity (legally a person) and recognized as such in law.
Corrective Action
The process in place that is followed once there is a lease violation to allow the tenant the opportunity to cure or rectify the confirmed violation.
Denied
To decline or refuse to admit or accept the existence, truth, or validity of.
Detailed Reason LostThis is the column in your churn spreadsheet that is required to be completed on a weekly basis. This should include as much detail as possible.
Note: Phrases such as "Owner not happy" are not permissible.
Disabled
Any person with a disability: including but not limited to mental or physical, that limits a major life activity such as movement, senses, or activities.
Discrimination
The refusal to rent, repair, or negotiate terms due to race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity and sexual orientation), disability, familial status, or national origin.
Domain
Refers to the following: PURE platform, CFO, Institutional, Resident Portal, Client Portal, and Vendor Portal.
Dwelling
A house, apartment, or other place of residence.
Early Termination
When a tenant chooses to terminate their residential agreement before the maturity date.
Enhanced Damage Program (EDP)

A program to protect Investor Client Properties in the event of PURE-approved and registered pets. This only applies to leases that have PURE-approved and registered pets. Undisclosed and unauthorized pets are not included in the EDP. Additionally, any damage caused by Assistance Animals is not covered under the EDP and is the sole responsibility of the Resident.A PURE Program in which PURE agrees to repair any documented pet damage, up to $2,000 per lease, for pet damages exceeding the Resident's Security Deposit or SDRP coverage, in exchange for allowing their property to be listed as "pet negotiable" or "pet friendly." This removes the risk of placing a pet on the lease.
Entities
Properties, Residents, Clientship groups, Vendors, Lease Profile, People.
The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA)
An Act that makes it unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant, with respect to any aspect of a credit.
Equal Opportunity Employer

An employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race (including but not limited to the wearing of natural hairstyles such as afros, braids, twists, and locks), color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
Essential Appliances
Those appliances that are necessary, and indispensable for health and safety.
Evaluation of Property
A review of the property for the purpose of capturing conditions and deficiencies at a specific time and date.
Eviction
A legal proceeding resulting in the Resident(s) vacating the property.
Evictions in Process
Number of evictions in progress at month end.
Evaluation of Property
A review of the property for the purpose of capturing conditions and deficiencies at a specific time and date.
External-Service Communication
Communication between a service and a 3rd party API (i.e. accounting/NETSUITE, maintenance/PropertyMeld, comms/TWILIO, DMS/Docusign).
Fair Housing Act

The 1968 Act expanded on previous acts and prohibited discrimination concerning the sale, rental, and financing of housing based on race, religion, national origin, sex, (and as amended) handicap, and family status.
FIDO Score/Paw Score
An animal rating that is provided as a result of the screening process at Petscreening.com.
Guarantor A person, or organization that guarantees the lease terms and payment will be met.
Hard Delete Removing the data from the database.
HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)
A federal law that protects sensitive patient health information from being disclosed.
Housing Assistance

Appropriate referrals by a supervising agency to federal, state, local, or private agencies or organizations, for assistance with forms, applications, financial subsidies, or other monetary assistance for housing of low-income people.
Inactive
Indicates absence of action, indisposition to activity, or cessation of activity.
Landlord
Any person, acting as principal or through an agent, having the right to offer residential rental property for rent, and includes a predecessor in interest to the landlord.
Late Payment
Any Payments paid after their due date, including a grace period if applicable.
Lead-Based Paint Renovation, Repair, and Painting Rule

In accordance with the EPA’s Lead-Based Paint Renovation, Repair, and Painting (RRP) Rule, it is PURE company policy that a disclosure identifying the possible existence of lead-based paint be on file within the PMS for all homes constructed before 1978. Residents moving into a home constructed before 1978 must be provided with the EPA-published brochure, “Protect Your Family From Lead in Your Home.”
Lease
A contract by which one party conveys land, property, services, etc. to another for a specified time, usually in return for a periodic payment.
Lease Modification
Addition/Removal of resident or animal or other term listed in the lease.
Lease Violation
Any action, intentional or unintentional that conflicts with the terms of the signed Residential Rental Agreement.
Leasing

The act of all interactions with prospects by Centralized Leasing assisting with viewing a property, application process, screening, and qualifying as an approved applicant, by Centralized Leasing using Tenant Turner, Showmojo.
Leasing Specialist
Member of the Centralized Leasing Team that acts as the liaison for all prospects interested in a property from inquiry throughout the process.
Lock Outs
Tenant Unable to gain access to property with key or code.
Maintenance
The act of performing routine checks, repairs or upgrades to a property.
Management End Date

The final day of full management services including but not limited to maintenance processing, accounting, tenant communication, and owner communication. Once entered into the management software, a change of this date is driven by the Client and should not be changed otherwise.
Managing Clients

Day-to-day operations that require the approval or notification of the Client. The Senior Property Manager handles all Client correspondence, including PMA Renewals, Client Contributions, and any other matters that pertain to the Client’s portfolio. In the event the Senior Property Manager is unavailable and there is an immediate need, the Operations Manager is the next point of contact.
Market (Previously known as Brand or Office) A single company under the PURE corporate umbrella.
Marketing for Rent

The act of making a property rent-ready + Marketing the Property + Performing Market Analysis + Writing the Property Listing + Capturing Photos + Signage + Advertising + Showing Set Up Details in preparation for showings.
Move In
The act of tenant fulfilling the requirements for a property, and then completing the leasing process. The Tenant is then ready to take possession of the leased premises.
Move Out
The act of tenant fulfilling the lease requirements for a property, and then following the move out process.
Move-In Evaluation
Move Out The act of the tenant fulfilling the lease requirements for a property, and then following the move-out process.
Move Out Evaluation
The report created by PM in order to document the condition a property is in once the tenant has turned over possession.
Non Sufficient Funds - NSF
Non-sufficient funds, when an ACH transaction is returned, or a check is returned.
Non-Essential Appliances
Those appliances that are NOT required/necessary, to meet health and safety standards.
Notice of Termination Date
The date that we receive written notice of termination from the client.
Occupied Listed Doors
Total occupied properties that are active listings at month end. This count should not include tenant placement accounts.
Occupied Unlisted Doors
Total occupied properties at month end that are NOT active listings. This count should not include tenant placement accounts.
Onboarding
The act of activating an owner or tenant after agreement negotiations, benchmarking, and closing thus completing the cycle of screening interested parties.
Onboarding Specialist
An appointed PURE Representative responsible for facilitating the activities associated with setting up the business relationships between the Client and their PURE Property Management experience.
Paw Score/FIDO Score
A rating provided as a result of the screening process at Petscreening.com.
Pests
Includes (but is not limited to) bed bugs, cockroaches, mites, termites, mice, rats, other vermin and insects. Pest control of ants and non-poisonous spiders is a Resident responsibility.
Pet A companion animal such as a family dog.
Petscreening.com
A PURE partnership to fairly assess costs and risks associated with Resident animals, provides screening services and results.
Pet Screening Profile
A 3rd Party screening to attain relevant information needed to calculate pet Fees. This information includes Breed, Age, Weight, Gender, Neutered/Spayed, Vaccination Record, and ESA status.
PMS
Property Management System A program used to store data on Owners, Properties, Leases, and Tenants.
Primary Service
Service responsible for CRUD action (Core, Comms, Tasks, Maintenance, Accounting, Leasing, Search, Documents).
Properties
Defines real property as a piece of land and any permanent fixtures attached to it, such as buildings and roads, but excludes anything that can be removed from the land without causing damage.
Property (Previously known as Building)

Holds 1 or many doors. Building A has 2 doors, Building B is a Single Family Rental with one door. A single or multi-family structure and all other structures within the specifications of the Property Management Agreement (PMA).
Property Management Agreement (PMA)
A legal document between the Client and PURE defining the roles and responsibilities between PURE and the Client.
Property Manager
The managing office performing Property Management Operations.
Properties
Defines real property as a piece of land and any permanent fixtures attached to it, such as buildings and roads, but excludes anything that can be removed from the land without causing damage.
RBP (Resident Benefit Program)
A program of services, cost savings, and features benefitting the Resident’s residence experience.
Reason for Management Termination
This is the canned reason for loss on the property page in your management software that you select.
Note: Classifying the reason as "other" is not a permissible reason and should not be selected.
Rent
All monetary obligations of Resident to Landlord under the terms of the Agreement, except security deposit.
Rent Ready
The maintenance involved to make a property ready to be occupied by a Resident.
Resident Ledger
Digital Record in PMS that contains the historic list of transactions (debit/credits from original entries) made to an accounting ledger - specific to the tenant.
Resident Occupied
(Resident in Place) An existing Resident with a Lease is occupying or residing in a property owned by the new Client.
Residential Rental Property
Any dwelling or unit that is intended for human habitation, including any dwelling or unit in a mobile home park.
Residential Rental Agreement
A Lease, the legal contract that defines the roles and responsibilities of both the Resident and the property Client for the duration of the lease.
Resident Ledger
Digital Record in PMS that contains the historic list of transactions (debit/credits from original entries) made to an accounting ledger - specific to the tenant.
Resident Portal

Digital Account in PMS that allows tenant-specific access to their account pertaining to the rental agreement/ lease. This Portal is multi-functional and is used to disseminate information, store documents, and allow electronic payments/ACH.
Residential Rental Agreement
A Lease, the legal contract that defines the roles and responsibilities of both the Resident and the property Client for the duration of the lease.
Residential Rental Property
Any dwelling or unit that is intended for human habitation, including any dwelling or unit in a mobile home park. Resolution The process of resolving.
Restricted Breeds
Pre-defined breeds that are not allowed by PURE Property Management.
Retaliation
Any threat or any other adverse action against a tenant for exercising or attempting to exercise any right guaranteed under the Residential Tenant Protections Ordinance.
Screening of Applicant

Verification of identity, income, employment, credit eligibility, criminal, bankruptcy, and eviction records. The applicant’s pet or assistance animal is screened via PetScreening. All applicants, regardless of whether or not they have a pet or assistance animal, are required to complete a PetScreening profile in order to comply with PURE company policies.
SDRP + Monthly Fees

Security Deposit Replacement Program - offers Residents a choice between paying the traditional security deposit or paying a non-refundable monthly fee for the duration of their occupancy instead. The monthly fee is not held by PURE but paid to YRIG for Security Deposit Insurance on which PURE is the insured party.Second Nature
The third-party facilitator of the Resident Benefit Package.
Section 8 Rental Assistance
Rental aid in which the tenant receives tenant-based housing assistance under Section 8 of the United States Housing Act of 1937, also known as the Housing Choice Voucher Program.
Security Deposit
An amount of money that is required to be paid by the future Resident, upfront, to offset any potential damage to the property during their residency
Security Deposit Disposition

This is the document that lists turnover work orders needed at the property at the point of move-out, lists the charges for those repairs, then deducts from the SD on file leaving the amount due to the tenant or owed by tenant once calculated.
Self Showing

This refers to the ability of any prospective tenant to view the property independently (as required) in preparation for applying. This is done by having a digital lock box on the property, and a code generated for access.
Service Communication
Communication between domains and subdomains. (services i.e., accounting, maintenance)
The Servicemembers’ Civil Relief Act of 2003, SCRA
The federal law designed to protect service members by providing unique rights to lease termination in addition to other protective provisions.
Standards of Conduct
An individual has acted in good faith and in a way that they believe was in the best interests of the organization.
Sub-Domain
Refers to backend services providing functionality to the domains (Core, Accounting, Maintenance, Leasing, Comms, Document Management Services, Search, Project Management)
Tags
Keyword(s) indicating specific circumstances relevant to the property.
Tenancy
The lawful right or entitlement of a tenant to continuously use or occupy a residential The lawful right or entitlement of a tenant to continuously use or occupy a residential property
Tenant
Any other natural person entitled to lease any residential property
The CAN-SPAM Act of 2003
Requires the Federal Communications Commission to issue rules concerning commercial e-mail and some text messages sent to wireless devices such as cell phones—not email in general.
The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA)

Prohibits creditors from discriminating against credit applicants based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, or age, because an applicant receives income from a public assistance program, or because an applicant has in good faith exercised any right under the Consumer Credit Protection Act.
The Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act (FACTA) 2003

It gives consumers the right to one free credit report a year from the credit reporting agencies, and consumers may also purchase, for a reasonable fee, a credit score along with information about how the credit score is calculated. The Act also requires the provision of "risk-based-pricing" notices and credit scores to consumers in connection with denials or less favorable offers of credit. The Act also adds provisions designed to prevent and mitigate identity theft, including a section that enables consumers to place fraud alerts in their credit files, as well as other enhancements to the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Certain provisions related to data security ("red flags" of possible identity theft) were amended by the Red Flag Program Clarification Act of 2010, Pub. L. 111-319, 124 Stat. 3457, to clarify and narrow the meaning of "creditor" for purposes of those provisions.
The Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA)

Protects information collected by consumer reporting agencies such as credit bureaus, medical information companies, and tenant screening services. Information in a consumer report cannot be provided to anyone who does not have a purpose specified in the Act.
The Servicemembers’ Civil Relief Act of 2003, SCRA

A federal law designed to protect service members by providing unique rights to lease termination in addition to other protective provisions.The Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act (SCRA) postpones or suspends certain civil obligations to enable service members to devote their full attention to duty and relieve stress on their families. The SCRA covers all active duty service members, reservists, and members of the National Guard while on active duty.
The Uniform Regulations of Landlord-Tenant Act, URLTA

A law governing residential landlord and tenant rental agreements entered into or renewed after July 1, 1975. Comply with all obligations primarily imposed upon tenants by applicable building and housing codes; · keep the tenant's premises “as clean and safe as the condition of the premises permit”; · dispose of garbage, rubbish and other wastes from the dwelling unit “in a clean and safe ... States that have adopted and enforced URLTA guidelines include Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Connecticut, Florida, Hawaii, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Michigan, Mississippi, Montana, Nebraska, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Oregon, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and Washington.
Turnover
The act of one tenant moving out of a property, evaluating the property then preparing it for the next tenant, and marketing with new rent rate.
Type of Action Action types are User/platform or System.
Unauthorized Animals

An animal that is not registered on a resident's PetScreening.com Profile, and has not been disclosed to the Property Manager. Unauthorized animals discovered on a property are considered a lease violation, and where permitted by law, can be grounds to begin the eviction process. If a Resident fails to disclose an animal at any point during the term of the Residential Rental Agreement, at the Operations Manager’s discretion the Resident may be allowed to complete the animal screening process to certify any unauthorized animal.
The Uniform Regulations of Landlord-Tenant Act, URLTA
A law governing residential landlord and tenant rental agreements entered into or renewed after July 1, 1975.
Unit (AKA Door)
A single property unit (123 Willow Unit #2A). Previously went by “unit.”
A single-family rental (SFR) is a single-door.
Vacancy
A reference to your portfolio with a listing of a Unit/Door/Property that has no one living there, and no active lease agreement in place.
Verifast
PURE Program that is used to screen applicants.
YRIG - Your Renters Insurance Group
The third-party facilitator of insurance coverage.
